IGView.js

Contains the IGView class.

Author

Karla Friedrichs

GOLMI Extension For Bachelor Thesis

"Modeling collaborative reference in a Pentomino domain using the GOLMI framework"

IGView

Instruction giver view.  Spoken instructions are emitted, guiding a user to choose a specific object.

Functions
Constructor
constructor(
modelSocket,
tasks,
referenceAlg,
gripperId,
feedbackTimeInt = 10000,
feedbackDistInt = 2,
maxTries = 3
)

Initializes socket events.

Params
modelSocket

Socket io connection to the server

tasks

object mapping task index to tasks, in JSON format as accepted by the Model

referenceAlg

str, name of the algorithm to use for an initial instruction, one of ["IA", "RDT", "SE"].  Determines the feedback algorithm too.

gripperId

identifier used by the Model for the Gripper the instructed user is controlling

feedbackTimeInt

int, optional: time (ms) to wait before giving feedback if the user is idle

feedbackDistInt

optional: distance (blocks) the user has to move the Gripper before feedback is given

maxTries

int, number of incorrect selections allowed per task

Properties
nTasks

number of tasks the instance has been assigned

nextTask

Returns next task, counter currentTask is incremented.  If there are no more tasks, returns null.

hasStarted

true if some task (excluding training tasks) has been loaded already

width

Number of blocks per row on the board.  If no config was loaded, returns the default 20.

height

Number of blocks per column on the board.  If no config was loaded, returns the default 20.

referenceAlg

Function used to generate referring expressions.

feedbackAlg

Function used to generate feedback expressions.

Functions
setAlgorithms
setAlgorithms(
referenceAlgName
)

Takes a string and chooses the appropriate class functions for reference generation and feedback-giving.  Logs an error if function could not be found and defaults to IA and simpleFeedback.

Params
referenceAlgName

str, name of the REG algorithm to use.  One of ["IA", "RDT", "SE"].

getGripperX
getGripperX(
stepsBack = -1
)
Params
stepsBack

int < 0, how many logged positions to look back

Returns

gripper x coordinate stepsBack steps back, undefined if no coordinate has been logged yet

getGripperY
getGripperY(
stepsBack = -1
)
Params
stepsBack

int < 0, how many logged positions to look back

Returns

gripper y coordinate stepsBack steps back, undefined if no coordinate has been logged yet

getObj
getObj(
id
)
Params
id

Obj id

Returns

object associated to the given id, undefined if id does not exist

getObjValue
getObjValue(
id,
property
)
Params
id

Obj id

property

Obj property name

Returns

value an object with the given id has for the given property name, undefined if id is unknown or property not defined

start
start()

Load the first task and start listening to model updates.  Logs an error if loading fails.

taskCompleted
taskCompleted()

User completed a task. Emit a message to the user, stop updating and try loading the next task.  Emits 'logSegment' event to the document.

welcome
welcome()

Welcome the user, explain rules, etc.

goodbye
goodbye()

Thank the user for participating, etc.  Emit a 'tasksCompleted' event to the document.

giveInstruction
giveInstruction()

Construct and queue a full instruction, describing the target piece to the user, using the selected REG algorithm.

giveFeedback
giveFeedback(
force = false
)

If a feedback algorithm is set, react to the user's progress by constructing and queueing a feedback message.  Depending on the algorithm, this might be further information, correction or support.

Params
force

if set to true, no additional checks will be made

abortAllMsgs
abortAllMsgs()

Stop any audio currently playing and delete waiting messages.

startFeedbackTimeout
startFeedbackTimeout(
delay
)

Give feedback to the user after some time has elapsed.  Stop the loop using stopFeedbackTimeout.

Params
delay

time (ms) to wait before generating feedback

stopFeedbackTimeout
stopFeedbackTimeout()

Stop giving feedback in regular time intervals.

IA
IA()

Construct a reference using the incremental algorithm.  Algorithm adapted from E. Reiter & R. Dale (1992).  See https://​aclanthology​.org​/C92-1038​.pdf and the thesis for the full source and a description.

RDT
RDT()

Function for the initial instruction when using the RDT algorithm by A. Denis 2010.  See https://​aclanthology​.org​/W10-4203​.pdf.  Define a 'nested class' Domain. Initially create the referential space and generate the first instruction.

Returns

initial instruction created using the RDT algorithm

Domain

Represents a domain as used by the RDT algorithm.

Functions
Constructor
constructor(
ground,
semanticDesc,
salience,
partition
)
Params
ground

set of object in this Domain

semanticDesc

set of property-value pairs applying to all objects in the ground

salience

int, score describing how 'activated' a Domain is in the current dialogue

partition

triple: property name, object mapping property values to sets of objects with this value, focus of partition

IGView
Functions
generateRDT
generateRDT(
t = (new Set([this.currentTarget]))
)

Generate a new reference to the current target object, using the current referential space.  (see original paper Fig. 2: generate)

Params
t

optional: referent or set of referents to generate a referring expression for default: set containing current target

Returns

referring expression describing t

restructure
restructure(
D,
S
)

Restructure the referential space after a reference within D, using only the persistent properties of S. Transient properties and all Domains and partitions generated using them are deleted.  (see original paper Fig. 3: restructure)

Params
D

Domain

S

set of property-value pairs

simpleFeedback
simpleFeedback(
force = false
)

Dummy feedback algorithm to use for algorithms that don't come with a feedback mechanism by default. Resorts to giving positive or negative signals when the user is moving. If the user doesn't act, the reference algorithm is called to re-produce a referring expression (repeat type feedback).

Params
force

bool, if set to true, no additional checks will be made

Returns

natural language feedback expression or null

RDTFeedback
RDTFeedback(
force = false
)

Feedback algorithm from A. Denis 2010.  See https://​aclanthology​.org​/W10-4203​.pdf (feedback algorithm given in Figure 4).  Feedback is emitted with respect to the current focus on objects from the most salient Domain containing the target. The internal referential space will be updated with each generated feedback.

Params
force

bool, if set to true, no additional checks will be made

Returns

natural language feedback expression or null

SEFeedback
SEFeedback(
force = false
)

Feedback to be used on its own.  Produces incremental instructions relative to the current gripper position. See the thesis for details on the motivation of this algorithm.

Params
force

bool, if set to true, no additional checks will be made

Returns

natural language feedback expression or null
